com.sayem.appium.pagefactory.framework.browser

Class LocalBrowserBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sayem.appium.pagefactory.framework.browser.LocalBrowserBuilder

  • public class LocalBrowserBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    Builder class for creating a Browser that is running on the same host as the test code. Creates either a ChromeBrowser, FirefoxBrowser, or InternetExplorerBrowser.

    You can call the more general getBuilder(WebBrowserType, String), or the more specific methods getChromeBuilder(String), getFirefoxBuilder(String), and getInternetExplorerBuilder(String). Then call the methods to add parameters, such as withBrowserBinaryPath(String), and finally call build() to create the Browser instance.

    A Browser is basically a wrapper for a WebDriver that greatly simplifies configuration, adds useful utilities, and has methods for loading Page's. Pages provide an object-oriented solution to Selenium testing. You can write Page classes that model a web page in the web app you are testing.

      • getBuilder

        public static LocalBrowserBuilder getBuilder(WebBrowserType browserType,
                                             java.lang.String baseTestUrl)
        Get a LocalBrowserBuilder for the given browser and base URL for the webapp you are testing against.
        Parameters:
        browserType - - type of Browser, either CHROME, FIREFOX, or IE
        baseTestUrl - - base URL for your webapp, e.g. http://my.site.com/base

      • build

        public WebBrowser build()
                 throws WebDriverException
        Creates the Browser instance, which includes creating the actual Browser process via the underlying WebDriver.
        Returns:
        - a FirefoxBrowser, ChromeBrowser, or InternetExplorerBrowser
        Throws:
        WebDriverException
